content.question: Which of the Lewis diagrams shown above is the more likely structure of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and why?

choices.label: Diagram 1, because all the atoms have a formal charge of <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Diagram 1, because double bonds are stronger than triple bonds.
Diagram 2, because all the atoms have a formal charge of <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Diagram 2, because triple bonds are stronger than double bonds.

content.answer: Diagram 1, because all the atoms have a formal charge of <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
